t: Proverbs 22
A*pn good name is to be chosen over great wealth; favor*ln is better than silver and gold.
Rich*pn and poor have this in common: the*ln Lord*s makes them all.
A*pn sensible person sees danger and takes cover, but*ln the inexperienced keep going and are punished.
Humility,*pn the fear of the Lord,*s results*ln in wealth, honor, and life.
There*pn are thorns and snares on the way of the crooked; the*ln one who guards himself stays far from them.
Start*pn a youth out on his way; even*ln when he grows old he will not depart from it.
The*pn rich rule over the poor, and*ln the borrower is a slave to the lender.
The*pn one who sows injustice will reap disaster, and*ln the rod of his fury will be destroyed.
A*pn generous person will be blessed, for*ln he shares his food with the poor.
Drive*pn out a mocker, and conflict goes too; then*ln quarreling and dishonor will cease.
The*pn one who loves a pure heart and*ln gracious lips — the king is his friend.
The*pn Lord’s*s eyes keep watch over knowledge, but*ln he overthrows the words of the treacherous.
The*pn slacker says, “There’s a lion outside! I’ll*ln be killed in the public square!”
The*pn mouth of the forbidden woman is a deep pit; a*ln man cursed by the Lord*s will fall into it.
Foolishness*pn is bound to the heart of a youth; a*ln rod of discipline will separate it from him.
Oppressing*pn the poor to enrich oneself, and*ln giving to the rich — both lead only to poverty.
Words of the Wise
Listen*pn closely, pay attention to the words of the wise, and*ln apply your mind to my knowledge.
For*ln it is pleasing if you keep them within you and*ln if they are constantly on your lips.
I*ln have instructed you today — even you — so*ln that your confidence may be in the Lord.*s
Haven’t*ln I written for you thirty sayings about*ln counsel and knowledge,
in*ln order to teach you true and reliable words, so*ln that you may give a dependable report to*ln those who sent you?
Don’t*pn rob a poor person because he is poor, and*ln don’t crush the oppressed at the city gate,
for*ln the Lord*s will champion their cause and*ln will plunder those who plunder them.
Don’t*pn make friends with an angry person, and*ln don’t be a companion of a hot-tempered one,
or*ln you will learn his ways and*ln entangle yourself in a snare.
Don’t*pn be one of those who enter agreements, who*ln put up security for loans.
If*ln you have nothing with which to pay, even*ln your bed will be taken from under you.
Don’t*pn move an ancient boundary marker that*ln your ancestors set up.
Do*pn you see a person skilled in his work? He*ln will stand in the presence of kings. He*ln will not stand in the presence of the unknown.
